A secure, centralized case management platform on ServiceNow that:

  • Creates a complete case record for each child with automatic alerts for required check-ins
  • Tracks all interactions, documents, and interventions in one auditable timeline
  • Flags high-risk cases automatically based on predefined criteria
  • Manages multi-agency collaboration with controlled access and information sharing

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Child protection charities manage complex cases involving multiple touchpoints (social workers, schools, legal teams, families). Paper based or fragmented digital records lead to missed follow-ups, lost documentation, and safeguarding risks. Staff turnover means critical case history gets lost.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Products to Use:

  • Customer Service Management (adapted for case management)
  • IntegrationHub (connect with school databases, court systems)
  • Performance Analytics (track outcomes, intervention effectiveness)
  • Mobile App (field workers access case info on the go)

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

The solution requires integration with existing local authority case management systems and secure data sharing agreements between agencies (social services, schools, healthcare, police). GDPR compliant hosting is essential given the sensitivity of child protection data. Mobile offline capability is needed for field social workers. Successfully implementing this depends on cross-agency collaboration agreements and staff training on standardized data protocols.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Key challenges include: securing cross agency data sharing agreements and overcoming institutional resistance to shared platforms ensuring GDPR compliance while enabling appropriate information access managing change across multiple organizations with varying digital maturity migrating and standardizing data from legacy systems and maintaining user trust that the system supports rather than surveils their work. Additionally, preventing algorithmic bias in risk assessment and ensuring the solution remains sustainable beyond initial implementation require careful governance frameworks.
